SEARCH
Package sh.brane.rpc

Enum Class TestNodeMode

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<TestNodeMode>
sh.brane.rpc.TestNodeMode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<TestNodeMode>, Constable
public enum TestNodeMode extends Enum<TestNodeMode>
Represents different test node implementations and their RPC method prefixes.

Each test node (Anvil, Hardhat, Ganache) uses a different prefix for its custom RPC methods. For example, to mine a block:

  • Anvil: anvil_mine
  • Hardhat: hardhat_mine
  • Ganache: evm_mine

This enum is used internally by Brane.Tester to construct the correct RPC method names when interacting with test nodes. Users typically don't need to use this enum directly unless implementing custom test node interactions.

Usage: 


 TestNodeMode mode = TestNodeMode.ANVIL;
 String method = mode.prefix() + "mine"; // "anvil_mine"
Since:
0.2.0
See Also:
  • Brane.Tester

  • Enum Constant Details

    • ANVIL

      public static final TestNodeMode ANVIL
      Foundry's Anvil test node.

      Anvil is a fast, local Ethereum development node from the Foundry toolkit. It uses the anvil_ prefix for its custom RPC methods.

      See Also:
      • Anvil Documentation

    • HARDHAT

      public static final TestNodeMode HARDHAT
      Hardhat Network test node.

      Hardhat Network is the default network for Hardhat, a popular Ethereum development environment. It uses the hardhat_ prefix for its custom RPC methods.

      See Also:
      • Hardhat Network Documentation

    • GANACHE

      public static final TestNodeMode GANACHE
      Ganache test node.

      Ganache is a personal blockchain for Ethereum development from Truffle Suite. It uses the evm_ prefix for its custom RPC methods.

      See Also:
      • Ganache Documentation

    • prefix

      public String prefix()
      Returns the RPC method prefix for this test node.

      The prefix is used to construct full RPC method names by appending the method name. For example, ANVIL.prefix() + "mine" yields "anvil_mine".

      Returns:
      the method prefix including the trailing underscore (e.g., "anvil_", "hardhat_", "evm_")
